overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FeCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M n C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The two particle diagrams below represent saturated solutions of each compound at equilibrium.
content.question: Which of the following explains which of the properties listed in the table is best represented by the particle diagram?

choices.label: The particle diagrams best represent that <math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the ions from both compounds are solvated by water molecules.

The particle diagrams best represent that <math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because both compounds produce about the same amount of <math alttext="C O 3 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions from the dissolution.

The particle diagrams best represent that <math alttext="delta S naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because both compounds produce a very small amount of ions from the dissolution.

The particle diagrams best represent that the molar solubility is greater for <math alttext="F e C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FeCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> compared to <math alttext="M n C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The particle diagrams best represent that the molar solubility is greater for <math alttext="F e C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FeCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> compared to <math alttext="M n C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
